body.p: When discussing the sharing of power, the Board noted that for most investees it will be clear that one party or body has decision‑making authority to direct the activities of an investee that significantly affect the investee’s returns. For example, for an investee that is directed by voting or similar rights, the governing body or board of directors would typically be responsible for strategic decision‑making. Thus, the current ability to direct that body would be the basis for power.
